Please be safe, take care of yourselves and families, and follow the directions of our officials!

Thanks for your understanding. We look forward to kicking off our 2020-2021 school year with all of you….soon!

4:30 pm Update: Predicted thunderclouds are clearly visible and we are receiving down strikes. Check out the lightning graphic attached to this post . Go indoors!

Late afternoon and evening thunderstorms brought widespread lightning across northern CA yesterday. The #PlumasNF saw strikes accompanied by rain in "lightning alley" in the north/northeastern PNF. Two very small fires have been reported and were quickly staffed, including one (.5 acre) near Lone Rock and another (.25 acre) near Coyote Creek in McReynolds Valley. Airplane recon, our "eyes in the sky" are combing the landscape for any new fire starts. Thunderstorms are predicted again today and tomorrow. The Hog Fire (near Hog Flat Reservoir) in Lassen County continues to contribute smoke to wide swathes of Northern California prompting a Health Advisory in Plumas & Sierra Counties. For information about the Hog Fire, including road closures and evacuation information, please see https://www.fire.ca.gov/incidents/ .

Some of our smaller (first come-first served) campgrounds are now open but with little to no services. Visitors need to bring trash bags, toilet paper, and hand sanitizer. Campgrounds include: Deanes Valley, Meadow Camp, Rock Creek, Silver Lake, and Snake Lake (Mt. Hough Ranger District) plus Conklin, Meadow View, Ross, Crocker and Laufman (Beckwourth Ranger District). Campfires are allowed in these developed recreation sites. Campfires are not allowed outside open, developed recreation sites. Portable propane campfire pits with shutoff valves are a handy substitute, with a valid CA campfire permit (http://www.preventwildfireca.org/Campfire-Permit/).

Reservation options for many #PlumasNF campgrounds may be found at https://www.recreation.gov. See www.outdoorsinplumas.com for other information including fees and site amenities for many of the facilities.

For a complete list of fire restrictions see the Fire Use Restrictions Forest Order on the Forest website at: https://fs.usda.gov/plumas/.

During these Unprecedented times, we want to capture and record our own rural stories of struggle and resiliency by interviewing our community!

Are you....?

• Working from home
• A Business Owner
• Educator
• A parent now “homeschooling” your kids
• Grocery Store Clerk
• Health Care Worker
• Student
• Recently unemployed
• And anything else… (The only requirement is that you are a Plumas County Resident!)

For more information, to send a picture, or sign up for an interview - Email Nina at nmartynn@sierrainstitute.us or call (530) 927-9621
